I tried to apply transitions from one screen (lets call it main) to the details screen but mine looks kind of janky. <https://goo.gl/photos/mYerpdDHBKTMHzm79> . The detail_enter transition looks wrong. If you click on an item that is partially out of the window and behind the statusBar then it is ignoring the excludeId fade transition. Likewise if you click on an item that is partially out of the window and behind the navigationBar then it is ignoring the excludeId fade transition. Also the main_exit looks wrong since the explode animation should explode all elements to the edge of the screen, but it appears that all of the elements are sliding down from the top. Any ideas of how to address these issues?

hey guys! anyone using retrofit2 and rxjava? im trying to use two subscribers and im running into all sorts of issues
post da code
i get `android.os.networkOnMainThreadException` when i add more subscribers
hmm, i actually haven't done something like that
but that might not be legal in retrofit
i'm pretty sure the underlying Call objects are one use only, so perhaps it's trying to do something like that when you add another subscriber
why do you need two subscribers?
can you just subscribe once and notify the interested entities when you get the response back?
also, does it work when you just subscribe once?
<@U0546QERR>: one subscriber is inside my service class which has business logic, the other subscribe is more for the UI
yes it works when i just use one subscriber
I'm not an expert, but couldn't you use a `PublishSubject` or `ReplaySubject` (depending on your needs) to get a second Observable out of this?
Although that might be overblown of a solution. As I said, no expert :D
everywhere i read, people say use .share() or .publish() but i cant get it to work… fml
<https://medium.com/@p.tournaris/rxjava-one-observable-multiple-subscribers-7bf497646675#.68v7xh1th> cant get it to work

attachments.title: RxJava — One Observable, Multiple Subscribers, Same Data
attachments.text: So we had to tackle a problem on the office the other day. The problem was fairly simple: Be able to share a Retrofit re…
attachments.fallback: Medium: RxJava — One Observable, Multiple Subscribers, Same Data

text: OMG MADE IT WORK
I think you call .replay().publish() on your observable, then subscribe both subscriber and the call connect()
Oh
thanks for being there for me. id like to thank the academy
What was the solution?

i just needed to set observeOn properly (to ensure that my internal subscriber could execute not on the main thread), then call share… then use that ConnectableObserver to subscribe then return that ConnectableObserver not the Observer from retrofit
then back in my Activity, i can add as many subscribers as i want
welp TIL, will probably need to use that someday
thanks :stuck_out_tongue:
the amazing thing is… that the `onNext` all fire across the `Subscriber`s in sequence
then the `onCompleted` in sequence
maybe it’s a timing thing….
i thought the first `Subscriber` initiates the retrofit call
i added a thread.sleep after the subscriber but it’s still in sequence
amazing and scary, i don’t know how this all works
